derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from haly 'holy' + obsolete butt 'flatfish' (because it was often eaten on holy days)

entry.def: A halibut is a large flat fish.

means.word_mean: 1. lean flesh of very large flatfish of Atlantic or Pacific
2. marine food fish of the northern Atlantic or northern Pacific; the largest flatfish and one of the largest teleost fishes
